maxKicksDescription.value: Determines the maximum number of kicks allowed for all screens. The maximum number of kicks on the Median screen is 15.

outliersDescription.value: Shows outliers on the boxplot as markings rather than being included in the whisker.

medianQuestion.value: What is the typical kick distance?

medianDescription.value: Median is the number that splits a sorted data set in half.

meanAndMedianQuestion.value: How does each kick influence the mean and median?

meanDescription.value: Mean is the average of all values in any data set.

variabilityQuestion.value: How spread out are the kick distances?

rangeDescription.value: Range is the distance between the minimum and maximum data points.

iqrDescription.value: Interquartile range (IQR) is the middle 50% of the data.

madDescription.value: Mean absolute deviation (MAD) is the average distance from each data point to the mean.

keyboardHelpDialog.jumpToStartOfNumberLi.value: Jump to start of number line

keyboardHelpDialog.jumpToEndOfNumberLine.value: Jump to end of number line

keyboardHelpDialog.medianScreen.jumpToSt.value: Jump to start of cards or number line

keyboardHelpDialog.medianScreen.jumpToEn.value: Jump to end of cards or number line

keyboardHelpDialog.meanAndMedianScreen.m.value: Move predict mean in smaller steps

keyboardHelpDialog.variabilityScreen.mov.value: Move Pointer, Interval Handles, or Interval Block

noBalls.value: Kick soccer balls to create a data set.

accessibleHelpText.value:
Show or hide red highlights marking middle soccer
 ball or balls and arrow pointing to median kick distance.
Show or hide purple triangle indicating mean kick distance.
Show or hide movable prediction pointer on field.
Show or hide movable prediction pointer on field.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Kick soccer balls and explore data set to find value of median.

playArea.value: At edge of field, up to {$maxBalls} kickers are ready to kick a soccer ball a random distance between 1 and 15 meters. Stacks of balls form when they land at the same distance. A sortable data card appears for each kicked ball recording the kick distance. Each ball can be moved to adjust its kick distance. There are checkboxes to auto-sort the data cards and highlight or predict the median.

controlArea.value: Additionally, access detailed median information, clear data set, and reset the sim to start over.

soccerBalls.value:
Currently, { NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 soccer balls on field.
[1] 1 soccer ball on field:
*[other] {$number} soccer balls on field:
}

cards.value:
{ NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 data cards are listed.
[1] 1 data card lists the kick distance as {$distances}.
*[other] {$number} data cards list the kick distances as {$distances}.
}

someBalls.value: Move soccer balls or sort distance data cards to explore data.

selectAccessibleHelpText.value: Choose card to grab or release to sort data

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore with or without data sorted numerically.
Analyze data cards with or without median value shown and located if data is sorted.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Kick soccer balls and explore data set to compare mean and median.

playArea.value: At edge of field, up to {$maxBalls} kickers are ready to kick a soccer ball a random distance between 1 and 15 meters. Stacks of balls form when they land at the same distance. A mark appears on a plot for each kicked ball recording the kick distance. Each ball can be moved to adjust its kick distance. There are checkboxes to highlight or predict the median and mean.

soccerBalls.value:
Currently, { NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 soccer balls on field.
[1] 1 soccer ball on field:
*[other] {$number} soccer balls on field:
}

plot.value:
{ NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 marks on plot.
[1] 1 mark on plot matches kick distance on field.
*[other] {$number} marks on plot match kick distances on field.
}

controlArea.value: Additionally, access detailed mean and median information, clear data set, and reset the sim to start over.

someBalls.value: Move soccer balls or explore plot to analyze data.

accessibleHelpText.value: Analyze data with or without median value shown and located on plot.
Analyze data with or without mean value shown and located on plot.

meanEquationDescription.value: Mean = {$values} all over {$total}, which equals {$sum} over {$total}

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Kick soccer balls and explore data sets to compare measures of variability.

playArea.value: At edge of field, up to {$maxBalls} kickers are ready to kick a soccer ball a random distance between 1 and 15 meters. Stacks of balls form when they land at the same distance. A mark appears on a plot for each kicked ball recording the kick distance. Each ball can be moved to adjust its kick distance. Explore the range, interquartile range (IQR), and mean absolute deviation (MAD) for each kicker’s kick distribution.

soccerBalls.value:
{$kicker} kicker selected. Currently, { NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 soccer balls on field.
[1] 1 soccer ball on field:
*[other] {$number} soccer balls on field:
}

plot.value:
{ NUMBER($number, type: "cardinal") ->
[0] 0 marks on plot
[1] 1 mark on plot matches kick distance on field
*[other] {$number} marks on plot match kick distances on field
}, and {$measure} is being explored.

controlArea.value: Additionally, access detailed variability information, clear data set, and reset the sim to start over.

someBalls.value: Move soccer balls or explore plot to analyze data.

accessibleHelpText.value: Compare kick distance distributions of four different kickers.
Show or hide movable prediction pointer on field.

rangeAccessibleHelpText.value: Predict and view range of kick distribution.

iqrAccessibleHelpText.value: Predict and view IQR of kick distribution.

madAccessibleHelpText.value: Predict and view MAD of kick distribution.

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore with or without range highlighted on plot.
Explore with or without IQR highlighted on plot.
Explore with or without MAD highlighted on plot.

accessibleParagraph.value: There is a box plot with arrows pointing to min, Q1, median, Q3, and max. IQR = Q3 minus Q1.

madEquationDescription.value: MAD = the quantity {$madValues} all over {$total}, which equals {$numerator} over {$total}.

accessibleParagraph.value: There is a diagram showing distances from each kick to left and right of mean. MAD = average of these distances.

accessibleHelpText.value: Define boundaries of interval region. Shift interval region to estimate distribution variability or future kick locations.
Determines whether an x or dot marks a kick distance on the plot.

moveGrabbedBallOrCardDescription.value: Move grabbed ball or card with Left and Right arrow keys, or A and D keys, or Up and Down arrow keys or W and S keys.

moveGrabbedBallDescription.value: Move grabbed ball with Left and Right arrow keys, or A and D keys, or Up and Down arrow keys or W and S keys.

moveInLargerStepsDescription.value: Move in larger steps with Page Up or Page Down key.

jumpToStartOfNumberLineDescription.value: Jump to start of number line with Home key.

jumpToEndOfNumberLineDescription.value: Jump to end of number line with End key.

jumpToStartOfCardsOrNumberLineDescriptio.value: Jump to start of cards or number line with Home key.

jumpToEndOfCardsOrNumberLineDescription.value: Jump to end of cards or number line with End key.

jumpBallToTickMarkDescription.value: Jump ball to tick mark with number Zero through Nine keys.
